title: Drawing, "Design for buckle", 1825–50
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on white laid paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The inner square has the shape of a quatrefoil. The two framing ribbons are beset with narrowly-standing diamonds. Between the ribbons and upon the points are round diamonds.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for buckle", 1825–50.
1825–50. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash on white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5378.
